titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Boush family papers, 1855-2012
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia 51108

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Boush family papers, 1855-2012. Accession 51108. Personal papers collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Helen Elizabeth McLeod and John Goodenow Tyler, III, of Norfolk.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The Boush family resided in Princess Anne County, Norfolk, and Virginia Beach, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Papers, 1855-2012, of the Boush family of Norfolk and Virginia Beach, Virginia containing a Boush family genealogy; portraits and photographs of the Boush family; clipping and card for Boy Scout Troop 62 (Oceana); power of attorney from Eileen Boush Davis to Eileen Davis Vernon; papers relating to the 1762 Samuel Boush map of Norfolk; appraisal of the artwork owned by Eileen Davis; 1862 sketch of Norfolk from Harper's Weekly; Ye Hysterical Historie of Norfolk Towne by Frank Wing; and transcript of letter, 5 February 1855, from Richard Wagner to a friend and related papers.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Samuel Boush's plan for Norfolk, 1762 (LVA map call number G3884.N6 1762.N5).

did.unittitle: Power of attorney, Eileen Boush Davis to Eileen Davis Vernon, 23 December 2008.
Papers relating to Samuel Boush map (1762) (map is located in the map collection, call number G3884.N6 1762.N5), 1945-2012.
City of Norfolk scene from Harper's Weekly, 19 April 1862.
Ye Hysterical Historie of Norfolk Towne by Frank Wing, 1931.
Richard Wagner letter and related correspondence, 1855, 1973-1974, 1986.
